SENT.plain: We present the case of a 17-year-old competitive athlete with an asymptomatic left ventricular aneurysm (LVA)
Echocardiography demonstrated hypoplasia of the septum and a large apical LVA
Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) detected a very thin and fibrotic wall of the LVA
Due to the potential risk of rupture the LVA was surgically resected and the apex of the left ventricle was covered with a patch plasty
The patient had an event-free postoperative course
Because of the potential risk of arrhythmia, the patient was recommended not to participate further in competitive sport
